intro: Cosmos juxtlahuacensis, commonly known as the Juxtlahuaca cosmos, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features feathery, silver-green leaves and produces small, spiky bracts beneath its flowers. Cosmos juxtlahuacensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
